snippet.title: Safety of high-energy particle collision experiments ...
snippet.description: The safety of high energy particle collisions was a topic of widespread discussion and topical interest during the time when the Relativistic Heavy Ion Collider (RHIC) and later the Large Hadron Collider (LHC)—currently the world's largest and most powerful particle accelerator —were being ...

snippet.title: First proton-lead collision test at the LHC successful ...
snippet.description: For the first time, scientists at the Large Hadron Collider have collided protons with lead ions, a feat that will give them insight into the quark-gluon plasma.

snippet.title: CERN - The European Organization for Nuclear Research
snippet.description: 05 April 2012. LHC physics data taking gets underway at new record collision energy of 8TeV. At 0:38 CEST this morning, the LHC shift crew declared 'stable beams' as two 4 TeV proton beams were brought into collision at the LHC's four interaction points.

snippet.title: Unexpected data from the Large Hadron Collider suggest the ...
snippet.description: Collisions between protons and lead ions at the Large Hadron Collider (LHC) have produced surprising behavior in some of the particles created by the collisions. The new observation suggests the collisions may have produced a new type of matter known as color-glass condensate.

snippet.title: Major Accelerators Closing in on Elusive Higgs Particle
snippet.description: Should Fermilab fail to uncover the Higgs, the LHC's higher collision energy is expected to produce an abundance of the elusive particle. ... Art Director and Special Publications Manager: Kerry G. Johnson Publication Designer and Production: ...

snippet.title: Photos: Large Hadron Collider, the World's Largest Atom ...
snippet.description: These photos show the world's largest particle accelerator, the Large Hadron Collider, at the CERN physics lab in Geneva, Switzerland.
